result.executive_summary: An AWS EC2 instance has been identified as performing SSH brute force attacks against remote hosts, indicating the instance may be compromised and being used to attack other systems. Immediate action is required to contain the threat and prevent further damage.
attack_chain: Initial Access via SSH Brute Force
immediate_actions: Isolate the affected EC2 instance to prevent further attacks
Investigate the instance for signs of compromise and gather forensic evidence
Implement temporary network-level controls to block the malicious IP address (203.0.113.45)
short_term_recommendations: Perform a full security assessment of the affected EC2 instance and the broader AWS environment
Review and strengthen SSH access controls, including implementing multi-factor authentication and limiting access to authorized users and systems
Enhance logging and monitoring to detect and respond to similar SSH brute force attacks in the future
long_term_recommendations: Implement a comprehensive cloud security strategy, including regular vulnerability assessments, security hardening, and continuous monitoring
Develop and test incident response and disaster recovery plans to ensure the organization is prepared to respond effectively to security incidents
Provide security awareness training to developers and operations teams to improve their understanding of cloud security best practices
investigation_queries: Review CloudTrail logs for any suspicious API activity or unauthorized access attempts on the affected EC2 instance
Check VPC Flow Logs for any unusual network traffic patterns originating from the affected instance
Analyze AWS Config data to identify any configuration changes that may have contributed to the security incident
Search AWS GuardDuty findings for any additional indicators of compromise or related security events
